item.title: US CyberGames
item.description:
This write up documents the challenges I solved during the US Cyber Games 2025 , specifically in the categories of Pwn, Forensics, Reverse Engineering, and Cryptography. Each section walks through my processâ€”from analyzing binary exploits and reconstructing OLED display data to decrypting protected files and extracting browser artifacts.

Drive Discovery

Challenge File: nothinginterestinghere.001
Category: Forensics
Tools Used: file, FTK Imager, base64

Description

Weâ€™re given a file named nothinginterestinghere.001 â€” clearly a disk image segment. Our task is to examine it and extract any hidden or deleted secrets.

item.title: Cybergame 2025 Writeups
item.description:
I took 1st place ðŸ¥‡ in CyberGame 2025, solving 71 out of 73 challenges and claiming 52 First bloods ðŸ©¸ along the way.

The game featured a wide variety of categories, including:

  • Web Exploitation & Binary Exploitation

  • Forensics

  • OSINT (Open Source Intelligence)

  • Cryptography

  • Malware Analysis & Reverse Engineering

  • Process and Governance

  • PyJails _(as part of the JAILE series)

Here are writeups for a few of the challenges I found particularly interesting.

item.title: Deadface 2024 CTF
item.description:
This is a writeup for DeadFace ctf 2024

Reverse Engineering

Cereal Killer 01

We are given a binary and an executable file. Running the executable we are prompted for a password I loaded up the binary file in IDA Pro and looked at the strings maybe the password is hardcoded lets see! The string obboreel stands out trying it out as the password and it was not the password. I did spin up x64dbg to debug the file and set a breakpoint before the jump of printing the bad message Access Denied.
